ch.epfl.lis.gnw
Class SteadyStateExperiment

java.lang.Object
  ch.epfl.lis.gnw.Experiment
      ch.epfl.lis.gnw.SteadyStateExperiment

public class SteadyStateExperiment
extends Experiment

Implements experiments where the stead-state of the network is measured.

Author:
Daniel Marbach (firstname.name@gmail.com), Thomas Schaffter (firstname.name@gmail.com)

printAll

public void printAll(java.lang.String postfix)
Print the mRNA data, append the given string to the filenames (e.g. "_nonoise_wildtype"). If translation is modelled, protein data is also printed

printMRNA

public void printMRNA(java.lang.String postfix)
Print the mRNA data, append the given string to the filenames (e.g. "-nonoise").

printProteins

public void printProteins(java.lang.String postfix)
Print the protein data, append the given string to the filenames (e.g. "-nonoise").

computeSteadyStates

public void computeSteadyStates()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Compute the steady-states for all the single-gene perturbations, one after the other. The result is stored in ssPerturbation.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

printSteadyStates

public void printSteadyStates(java.lang.String filename,
                              cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix1D wt)
Print the given steady-state vector (data). This function is usually used to print the wild-type.

Print the perturbation experiments (data).

addNoise

public void addNoise()
Add log-normal noise to the data

getMaximumConcentration

public double getMaximumConcentration()
Get the maximum concentration of all experiments. For now, only get the max concentration between mRNA levels. Later, perhaps leave the choice to the user if he prefer, e.g., to normalise by the mRNA OR protein levels.

normalize

public void normalize(double max)
Normalize (i.e. divide by) the given maximum value
